conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D and pass through baffles before entering containers E, F, or G.
Container E is located on the far left, container F is in the middle, and container G is on the far right.
Stream A is green and flows out from the top-left position.
Stream B is pink and flows out from the second position from the left.
Stream C is yellow and flows out from the third position from the left.
Stream D is blue and flows out from the far-right position.
The brown baffle is slanted to the right and positioned below stream A.

premise: Stream A strikes the brown slanted barrier and is deflected to the right.
conclusion: Stream A flows downward and enters container E.
The purple baffle is slanted to the left and positioned below stream B.

premise: Stream B hits the purple slanted barrier and is deflected to the left.
conclusion: Stream B flows downward and enters container F.
The orange baffle is slanted to the left and positioned below stream C.

premise: Stream C impacts the orange slanted barrier and turns left.
conclusion: Stream C flows downward and enters container F.
The blue baffle is slanted to the right and positioned below stream D.

premise: Stream D impacts the blue slanted barrier and turns right.
conclusion: Stream D flows downward and enters container G.

premise: Streams A and B mix after encountering their respective baffles, then meet with streams C and D after encountering the blue baffle.
conclusion: Most mixture of A, B, C, and D ends in container F; a thin stream of mixture from A, B, and C ends in container E; no stream ends in container G.
